snippet.title: Men accused of kidnap, attempted murder
snippet.content:
A 35-year-old man is in a serious condition after he was allegedly kidnapped, put in the back of a ute and significantly burned. Police say he was with a 36-year-old man when they were both grabbed in northern NSW on July 23. However, the 36-year-old managed to escape by jumping from the moving ute and hiding in nearby bushland. About 7.30pm that night, a motorist noticed the 35-year-old and a spot fire on the side of the road, and a burnt-out white Holden Commodore utility was later found at the scene, police say. The man, who had significant burns, was airlifted to Royal Brisbane Hospital where he remains in a serious condition. Police investigating the incident this week charged a 29-year-old man and a 28-year-old man. They say further arrests are expected.
Related Articles
Both men were charged with attempted murder and kidnapping. (C) AAP 2017
